title: Coeur de loups
description:
Done for Atomic3 and 20k as an Ottomata employee in 2021
Co-design with Atomic3 for an interactive light show where people howl into a microphone and wolves howl back in the woods along with audio-reactive moving lights.
Idea and Artistic Direction: Félix Dagenais et Louis-Xavier Gagnon-Lebrun
Lights: Louis-Xavier Gagnon-Lebrun et Nicola Dubois
Audio: Jean-Sébastien Côté
Video: Lionel Arnould
Interactive design: Ottomata
Programming and Integration: Samuel Tremblay
Scenography: Maude St-Louis
Technology: 20k Productions
Lighting Programming: Nicola Dubois
Photos: All images belong to their rightful owners.

title: The Dungeons & Dragons Experience
description:
D&D Experience is an immersive RFID-powered parkour game where players select a class at the start and engage in a series of interactive challenges, with their progress tracked via RFID bracelets.

Designed vibrant marketing. Coded and integrated on behalf of RodeoFX, the experience combines technology and gameplay to create an engaging adventure.

My contribution includes:
Software Architecture Design and Development
Front-End & Back-End Development
Electronics Programming
Photos: All images belong to their rightful owners.

title: Gravitations
description:
Project for Quartier des Spectacles with local artist Feline B, to transpose her artworks into an interactive mapping.

Art: Feline B
Programming & Tech: Nicolas Dubé-Pauzé, Samuel Tremblay
Production: Marie-Pierre Poulin & Sébastien Hell
Photos: All images belong to their rightful owners.

title: In my body
description:
Realtime generative visuals created for the show "In My Body" by BBOYIZM dance company, presented from February 27th, 2022, to March 25th, 2022, across Canada.

Project completed in collaboration with Mirari and Centre de Création O’Vertigo
Photos: All images belong to their rightful owners.

title: Destination BC
description:
Interactive LED Wall project for Zulu on behalf of Destination BC. This immersive installation features a dynamic wall that projects real-time reflections and shadows of passersby, blending them into stunning environments from British Columbia made by RodeoFX.

My Contribution:
On-Site Integration
Programming
Photos: All images belong to their rightful owners.

title: Tour du Grand Quai
description:
Project for Port de Montréal in 2023: 360° AR educational content synchronized with 3D assets and videos.
Clients can also upload their own 360° videos via a website and have them dynamically played on the installation.
Technical Direction: Nicolas Dubé-Pauzé & Jacob Lacasse
Programming: Samuel Tremblay & Nicolas Dubé-Pauzé
Photos: All images belong to their rightful owners.

title: Ados: cerveaux inventifs
description:
Project for Groupe DES on behalf of Musée de l'ingéniosité J. Armand Bombardier in 2022.
Various small interactive installations explaining scientific concepts to children.
Programming: Samuel Tremblay, Nicolas Dubé-Pauzé
Technical Direction: Nicolas Dubé-Pauzé, Jacob Lacasse
Integration: Jacob Lacasse, Samuel Tremblay, Nicolas Dubé-Pauzé
Design: Groupe DES
Photos: All images belong to their rightful owners.

title: Liste chantée
description:
Project for LG2 on behalf of Maxi. A Christmas stunt featuring a dynamic grocery list sung by a chorus.

Programming: Samuel Tremblay & Nicolas Dubé-Pauzé

title: La langue dans ma poche
description:
An interactive game show that seamlessly synchronizes multiple computers, managing various games and a central database through a state machine.

Tech and Network Infrastructure: Samuel Tremblay and Nicolas Dubé-Pauzé
Front-End: Lima Charlie, Samuel Tremblay
Integration: Nicolas Dubé-Pauzé, Samuel Tremblay, Jacob Lacasse
Design: Louis-Martin Duval
Photos: All images belong to their rightful owners.

title: Insectarium: Œil Composé
description:
Developed for the Espace pour la Vie Museum in 2022, this visual representation helps audiences better understand how insects perceive the world through their vision.

Tech: Nicolas Dubé-Pauzé
Programming: Samuel Tremblay, Jacob Lacasse
Photos: All images belong to their rightful owners.
